content:
EXISTING STRUCTURES
--------------------
### Extraction System at Position(-3.5, 27.5)
Consists of the following entity:
– Extraction system burner inserter at Position(-3.5, 27.5) with drop position Position(-3.5, 28.5)
 (Note: An associated wooden chest at Position(-3.5, 26.5) appears in the final map to buffer extracted items.)

### Copper Cable Factory at Position(2.5, 17.5)
Consists of the following entities:
– Input chest at Position(2.5, 17.5) serving as the copper plate intake  
– Burner inserter at Position(3.5, 17.5) placed at the factory interface using direction RIGHT  
– Burner inserter at Position(1.5, 17.5) feeding items into production  
– Assembling machine at Position(1.5, 19.5) whose role is to produce copper cable

### Depot Belt System at Position(3.5, 15.5)
Consists of the following entities:
– Wooden chest (belt depot) at Position(3.5, 15.5) providing an isolated depot  
– Transport belt segment at Position(4.5, 15.5) placed adjacent to the depot chest  
– Depot burner inserter at Position(3.5, 14.5) (using direction UP) that is intended to receive items via the belt

ERROR TIPS
----------
• Transport belt connection target error  
 Ensure that transport belts are never connected directly to a Prototype.SteamEngine. Always add an inserter to serve as the proper target entity before making the belt connection.

• Placement distance error  
 When placing entities such as wooden chests, verify that the target position is within maximum placement range. Move closer if the distance exceeds limits to avoid placement failure.

• Inventory verification error  
 Before executing a placement command, check that the required item (for example, a wooden chest) is available in the inventory to prevent “no … in inventory” errors.

• Variable reference error  
 Avoid referencing undefined variables (as with the “target_chest” issue). Confirm that all variable names are correctly defined and consistently used to prevent NameError incidents.
